page.title: 08Recreation&Community Centre
page.content: Unfortunately since the boundary changes of 1974-5 when the S.M.D.C. took over fromm the Cheadle Rural District Council, the centre has had to pay rates, unlike some of it's counterparts in neighbouring districts. Nevertheless the committee of trustees themselves in conjunction with others, like the M.S.C. Schemes,it has run over last few years has helped not only the Centre and Parish of Dilhorne but has found employment for many people in the area. Now in conjunction with the Standing Conferece of Voluntary Social Work Organisations in Staffordshire Community Programme, not onlyu work in tCentre and Parish is been carried out throughout the area of the South Moorlands, for the elderly and disabled in need. There is a computer club. All facilities are open to the public.
